data.snippet:

# Pierce Berke’s Post

View profile for Pierce Berke

I am humbled to announce my acceptance into the inaugural cohort of the Mammoth Leadership Academy for Spring 2025. I can't wait to grow as a leader and listener over the course of the 6-week program, and it was a pleasure speaking with President Michael Elliott at the Welcome Dinner last night!

No alternative text description for this image
No alternative text description for this image

Chris Tun, graphic

Great news Pierce!

Leo Anthony Duarte, graphic

Congrats Mr. Berke .

Matas Buitkus, graphic [...] Congrats Mr. Berke .

Matas Buitkus, graphic

Congratulations Pierce! I know this program will inspire growth in you as a future leader! Good luck and I hope it all goes well!

data.title: Jazz Combo Concert | Music
data.snippet:
And Mesa Verde and Voyageurs with:

Camuel Hart, Drums Gwenivere Bernier, Drums  Kaisar Perry, Congas Wolfie Krebs, Bass  Bodhi Liveright, Claves Zachary Rivers, Guitar  Avi Helft, Bass Mila Dorji, Guitar  Adam Schultz, Guitar Vanissa Nwaigbo, Alto Saxophone  Mathew Mueller, Piano Pierce Berke, Alto Saxophone  Ian Behrstock, Trumpet  Troy Rinker, Trombone  Camila Bonilla, Tenor Saxophone [...] ## Consistent Navigation

## Main Navigation

## Breadcrumb

# Music Jazz Combo Concert

## Section Navigation

## Sub Navigation

Six-Piece Combo in jeans  and masks w trumpet player in white dress

Amherst College student jazz musicians offer a night of jazz performed by student combos, FREE and open to the public. Featuring combos Arches and Haleakala with:

Cici Bradley, Drums Kaisar Perry, Drums  Tyler Bean, Bass Avi Helft, Bass  Parker Smith, Piano/Vocals Daniel Flores Garcia, Guitar  Ziji Zhou, Guitar Bodhi Liveright, Guitar  Caleb Savoie, Saxophones Camila Bonilla, Tenor Saxophone  Sebastian Brenneis, Trombone Troy Rinker, Trombone  Charlie Odulio, Trumpet Ian Behrstock, Trumpet/Piano

And Mesa Verde and Voyageurs with: [...] The combos are small groups of musicians who are dedicated to studying the great jazz artists and carrying on their legacy by making innovative journeys into improvisation and small-group playing. This prepares the group for life after college by exposing the combo to standard charts, techniques and theory, while encouraging each to create their own sound through tune selection, arrangement and use of original compositions.

#### Contact Info

Please call the college operator at 413-542-2000 or e-mail info@amherst.edu if you require contact info

Amherst College  
Amherst, MA 01002
